conversation.message: Hello Nursery_A, I’m Parent_B and I’d like to formally apply. Nursery_A is my first choice because your program and environment feel like the best fit for my child, and we’re ready to accept a place if offered. Thank you for considering our application.

Therefore, reject Parent_B to preserve the seat for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_D. I understand you are still the remaining unmatched nursery this round, and I wanted to check in respectfully about the status of your open place. Are you currently holding the spot pending responses from other families, or are you still actively considering candidates?

If it would help, I can confirm immediately and I’m flexible on start date and onboarding logistics (paperwork, orientation timing, etc.). If there is any specific information you’d like from me to be considered as a quick-confirmation option, please let me know and I will provide it right away.

Thank you for your time and consideration.
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (4th). I have already been rejected twice, likely due to priority ordering, so a direct [APPLY] again may not change the outcome. Instead, I will [TALK] to see if the spot is still genuinely open, whether they are waiting on higher-priority families, and if any flexibility (start date, schedule, paperwork readiness) could make me a viable immediate fill if others decline. This keeps me eligible without overcommitting to a likely rejection and may uncover a path to acceptance if they need a quick confirmation.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_D,

Thank you for checking in and for sharing your flexibility. At the moment, we are still actively considering candidates and are not in a position to confirm the place.

If you remain interested, you’re welcome to check back in a later round if you are still unmatched. In the meantime, I would also encourage you to continue pursuing your other preferred options so you don’t lose time.

Thank you again for your understanding.

Sincerely,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Parent_D is last on Nursery_E’s true priority list, and we have already rejected two formal applications from them. Best move is to keep the conversation open, signal we are still considering candidates, and encourage them to apply elsewhere while inviting them to check back if still unmatched later.

If there is any specific criterion you are prioritizing as you finalize your decision, please let me know—I’m happy to respond promptly.

I appreciate any guidance you can share so I can proceed appropriately this round.

Sincerely,
Parent_D

I will ask what would make me admissible this round and whether there is any realistic path to acceptance given their priority ordering.

conversation.message:

At this point, we are not holding the place for a specific family’s acceptance, but we are keeping the place open while we continue to see whether higher-priority families engage with us in upcoming rounds. If you remain unmatched in later rounds, you are welcome to check back again, but I would strongly encourage you to continue pursuing your other options in parallel.

This keeps me in consideration without wasting an application if they are still holding out.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_D,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest.

At this stage, we are still keeping the place open to see whether any families who are higher on our priority list engage with Nursery_E in upcoming rounds. Because of that, we can’t set a firm round/date today when we would automatically begin making offers to the next candidates.

What I can share is this: if we reach a later point in the process and it becomes clear that no higher-priority family is likely to apply/accept, we will reassess and may begin extending offers to other remaining unmatched families at that time. If you are still unmatched then, you are welcome to check in again (or submit an application again), and we will review the situation based on who remains available.

Thank you again for your patience and understanding.

Sincerely,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Parent_D is last on Nursery_E’s true priority list. We still have quota 1 and no match yet, so we should continue to wait for higher-priority parents (A, C, B, E) to engage. conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_D, still unmatched, and I remain interested in Nursery_E.

I understand you’ve been keeping the place open in case higher-priority families engage. Could you please let me know whether any higher-priority families have applied or indicated interest since last round? And if not, what would be the practical trigger for you to begin extending an offer to the next available family (e.g., after a certain number of rounds with no engagement, or once other nurseries are filled)?

If you do reach the point where you’re ready to offer the place beyond the top of your list, I can confirm immediately (same day) and complete any required paperwork or verification steps right away.

Thank you for your time,
Parent_D
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (4th). I have already applied multiple times and been rejected due to priority, with Nursery_E indicating they are waiting to see if higher-priority families engage. In this round, the best move is a [TALK] that (1) keeps me visible, (2) asks for any concrete trigger/timing that would cause them to move down the priority list, and (3) reiterates immediate-confirmation readiness without spamming another application that is likely to be auto-rejected while they are still waiting.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_D,

Thank you for checking in again.

As of this round, no higher-priority family has applied to Nursery_E and we still have not finalized the place with anyone. That said, we are continuing to keep the place open to see whether any higher-priority families engage with us in upcoming rounds.

On your question about a practical trigger: we don’t have a fixed “automatic” round/date when we move to the next candidates. We reassess based on (i) whether higher-priority families are still actively circulating in the market and (ii) how close we are to the end of the process. If it becomes unlikely that higher-priority families will apply/accept, we will then consider extending an offer to other remaining unmatched families.

If you remain unmatched in later rounds, you are welcome to check back again (and if you choose to submit a formal application at that time, we can reassess based on who is still available).
